title: Basic Vowels
subtitle: अ आ इ ई उ ऊ
overview: Six basic Sanskrit vowels. Each uses a different point of pronunciation: अ a at the soft palate, इ i at the hard palate, ऋ ṛ at the roof bump, ऌ ḷ at the teeth, उ u at the lips. Long vowels आ ई ऊ are held twice as long.

title: More Vowels
subtitle: ऋ ॠ ऌ ए ऐ ओ औ
overview: Compound vowels ए ऐ ओ औ are combinations of basic vowels. ऋ ॠ ऌ are rare retroflex and dental vowels.

title: Velars
subtitle: Soft palate · क ख ग घ ङ
overview: Velar consonants: tongue base at soft palate. क ka unvoiced, ख kha aspirated, ग ga voiced, घ gha voiced aspirated, ङ ṅa nasal.

title: Palatals
subtitle: Hard palate · च छ ज झ ञ
overview: Palatal consonants: tongue middle at hard palate. च ca, छ cha, ज ja, झ jha, ञ ña.

title: Retroflexes
subtitle: Roof of mouth · ट ठ ड ढ ण

title: Dentals
subtitle: Teeth · त थ द ध न

title: Labials
subtitle: Lips · प फ ब भ म
